documents.content:
# California Type 47 Full Liquor License (2026)

## Department of Alcoholic Beverage Control (ABC)

### What is a Type 47 License?
A Type 47 license allows restaurants to sell beer, wine, and all distilled spirits (full bar) for on-premises consumption with meals.

### Key Features
- **Beverages Allowed:** Beer, wine, AND all distilled spirits
- **Food Requirement:** At least 50% of gross sales must be from food
- **Minors:** Allowed on premises
- **Off-Sale:** Beer and wine only in sealed containers (no spirits off-sale)
- **Hours:** Per local ordinance (typically 6 AM - 2 AM)

### Application Fees (2026)
| Fee Type | Priority Application | Non-Priority |
|----------|---------------------|---------------|
| Application Fee | $19,840 | $1,135 |
| Fingerprinting | ~$60 | ~$60 |

**Priority Application:** Required when purchasing from secondary market or applying in census tracts with license limitations.

### Annual Fees by City Population (2026 - includes 2.72% CPI increase)
| City Population | Annual Fee |
|-----------------|------------|
| Over 40,000 | $1,545 |
| 20,000 - 40,000 | $1,260 |
| Under 20,000 | $985 |

### Additional Surcharges (Annual)
- Appeals Board Surcharge: 3% of license fee
- CHP Surcharge: $10/year
- Business Practices Surcharge: $24/year

### Transfer Fees (Person-to-Person)
- Transfer Application: $1,565
- Processing time: ~75 days

### Quota Limitations
**Important:** Type 47 licenses are population-limited:
- Maximum 1 license per 2,000 persons per county
- In populated counties (LA, SF, San Diego), this creates scarcity
- New licenses rarely issued â†’ must purchase on secondary market

### Official URLs
- ABC Main: https://www.abc.ca.gov
- License Lookup: https://www.abc.ca.gov/licensing/license-lookup/
- Annual Fees: https://www.abc.ca.gov/licensing/license-fees/annual-fee-schedule/
